author: eptwts
text:
indiehackers in the replies are like "noooo! getting to $1k MRR is actually SUPER hard"

i don't get how this mindset benefits you? it's self-cuckery 101

most of you can't get to $1k MRR because you're solving problems that don't exist, and your only form of distribution is the "build in public" community - no real marketing is being done

instead...

> build a product that solves a genuine problem
> then create content about how this product solves the problem in the social media platform that people with the problem frequent

if it doesn't get sales then you obviously failed one of the two steps, it's simple
